ZIP Code Lookup - Find a ZIP+ 4 Code By City Results | accessdate = 2007-01-18}} |area_code = [[Area code 562|562]]/[[Area code 714|714]]{{cite web | url = http://www.nanpa.com/nas/public/npa_city_query_step2.do?method=displayData&cityToNpaModel.stateAbbr=CA&cityToNpaModel.city=La%20Mirada | title = Number Administration System - NPA and City/Town Search Results | accessdate = 2007-01-18}} |website = [http://www.cityoflamirada.org/ http://www.cityoflamirada.org/] |blank_name = [[Federal Information Processing Standard|FIPS code]] |blank_info = 06-40032 |blank1_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature ID |blank1_info = 1652736 |footnotes = }} '''La Mirada''' is a city in southeast [[Los Angeles County]],[http://www.csac.counties.org/default.asp?id=49 Cities Within Each County], California State Association of Counties[http://www.cityoflamirada.org/factsht.htm City of La Mirada Web Site Fact Sheet] [[California]], [[United States]], and is one of the [[Gateway Cities]]. The population was 48,527 at the 2010 census, up from 46,783 at the 2000 census. It is the home of [[Biola University]] (formerly the [[Bible Institute of Los Angeles]]), an [[Evangelicalism|evangelical Christian]] institution of higher education. It is also the home of the [[La Mirada Theatre for the Performing Arts]]. The city of La Mirada was listed on CNN [[Money Magazine]]'s âBest Place to Liveâ list. La Mirada placed 34th on the list, with the La Mirada Theatre for the Performing Arts and the Splash! La Mirada Regional Aquatics Center as two of its main attributes.{{cite news | title = Best Places to Live: Top 100 | url = http://money.cnn.com/galleries/2007/moneymag/0707/gallery.BPTL_top_100.moneymag/34.html | accessdate = 2008-10-15 | work=CNN | first1=Kate | last1=Ashford | first2=Andrea | last2=Bartz | first3=Jeff | last3=Cox | first4=Asa | last4=Fitch | first5=Stephen | last5=Gandel | first6=Josh | last6=Hyatt | first7=Rob | last7=Kelley | first8=Kathleen | last8=Knight | first9=Joe | last9=Light}} ==History== La Mirada ([[Spanish language|Spanish]] for ''The View'') was the creation of two men, [[Andrew McNally]], a printer and mapmaker from Chicago (see [[Rand McNally]]) and his son-in-law Edwin Neff. In 1888, McNally purchased over {{convert|2200|acre|km2}} of [[Rancho Los Coyotes]],{{cite web | title = History of La Mirada | url = http://www.cityoflamirada.org/history.htm | accessdate = 2008-10-15 |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20080530212144/http://www.cityoflamirada.org/history.htm |archivedate = 2008-05-30}} south of [[Whittier, California|Whittier]], for $200,000. He developed {{convert|700|acre|km2}} into his own home called [[McNally's Windermere Ranch Headquarters|Windermere Ranch]] and surrounded it with olive, orange and lemon groves. McNally built a plant to process the olive oil, which was of the best quality, as well as a railroad station on Stage Road. From here his olive oil and fruit were shipped all over the U.S. In 1896, McNally turned his property over to his daughter and his son in law. McNally and Neff formed the La Mirada Land Company, which published a booklet entitled "The Country Gentleman in California", advertising parcels of land for sale including pictures, a map and descriptions of the scenic olive, alfalfa, lemon and grapefruit groves. In 1946, "Along Your Way", a "Station by Station Description of the Santa Fe Route Through the Southwest," describes La Mirada with a population of 213, surrounded by orange, lemon, walnut and olive groves; oil wells; olive oil factory; and fruit packing houses. The city received a lot of attention for the fact that it was going to be completely structured and planned out. Referred to as "the Nation's completely planned city" during the early 1950s,{{cite web | title = Postcard from State Fair | url = http://ourlamirada.com/lamirada/modelhome1953.html/history.htm | accessdate = 2008-10-15}} the city of La Mirada received a lot of attention from the [[California State Fair|State Fair]].{{cite web | title = 1953 State Fair Article | url = http://ourlamirada.com/lamirada/calstatefair1953.html/history.htm | accessdate = 2008-10-15}} The Fair praised the city for planning for the future while still maintaining practicality for today. In 1953, the land was sold to subdivisions for 5.2 million dollars, one of the largest real estate transactions in California. By 1960, the year the city was incorporated, La Mirada had grown from a mere 100 homes to over 8,000. The city was incorporated as "Mirada Hills" on March 23, 1960. On November 8, 1960, voters approved a change of name to the current La Mirada, which was officially certified on December 15, 1960. Today, the current population is just over 50,000 with the addition of a new subdivision on the eastern portion of the town. ==Geography== According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the city has a total area of {{convert|7.9|sqmi|km2}}. {{convert|7.8|sqmi|km2}} of it is land and {{convert|0.02|sqmi|km2}} of it (0.22%) is water. The city is on the border between Orange and Los Angeles Counties. The cities that border it on the [[Los Angeles County]] side is [[Santa Fe Springs, California|Santa Fe Springs]] to the west and [[Cerritos, California|Cerritos]] to the southwest; and unincorporated areas of Los Angeles County [[East La Mirada]],and [[South Whittier]] to the North. Then the cities which border it on the [[Orange County, California|Orange County]] side are [[Fullerton, California|Fullerton]] and [[La Habra, California|La Habra]] on the east; [[Buena Park, California|Buena Park]] on the south; also a small portions of unincorporated Orange County to the northeast. ==Demographics== ===2010=== The [[2010 United States Census]]{{USCensus-2010CA}} reported that La Mirada had a population of 48,527. The [[population density]] was 6,175.7 people per square mile (2,384.5/kmÂ²). The racial makeup of La Mirada was 29,462 (60.7%) [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 1,099 (2.3%) [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 394 (0.8%) [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 8,650 (17.8%) [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]], 142 (0.3%) [[Pacific Islander (U.S. Census)|Pacific Islander]], 6,670 (13.7%) from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 2,110 (4.3%) from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 19,272 persons (39.7%). The Census reported that 45,670 people (94.1% of the population) lived in households, 2,586 (5.3%) lived in non-institutionalized group quarters, and 271 (0.6%) were institutionalized. There were 14,681 households, out of which 5,368 (36.6%) had children under the age of 18 living in them, 8,971 (61.1%) were [[marriage|opposite-sex married couples]] living together, 1,731 (11.8%) had a female householder with no husband present, 802 (5.5%) had a male householder with no wife present. There were 544 (3.7%) [[POSSLQ|unmarried opposite-sex partnerships]], and 93 (0.6%) [[same-sex partnerships|same-sex married couples or partnerships]]. 2,536 households (17.3%) were made up of individuals and 1,578 (10.7%) had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 3.11. There were 11,504 [[family (U.S. Census)|families]] (78.4% of all households); the average family size was 3.48. The population was spread out with 10,246 people (21.1%) under the age of 18, 7,092 people (14.6%) aged 18 to 24, 11,609 people (23.9%) aged 25 to 44, 12,203 people (25.1%) aged 45 to 64, and 7,377 people (15.2%) who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 37.9 years. For every 100 females there were 92.2 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 89.4 males. There were 15,092 housing units at an average density of 1,920.7 per square mile (741.6/kmÂ²), of which 11,608 (79.1%) were owner-occupied, and 3,073 (20.9%) were occupied by renters. The homeowner vacancy rate was 0.8%; the rental vacancy rate was 4.0%. 36,660 people (75.5% of the population) lived in owner-occupied housing units and 9,010 people (18.6%) lived in rental housing units. ===2000=== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 46,783 people, 14,580 households, and 11,518 families residing in the city. The [[population density]] was 5,960.6 inhabitants per square mile (2,301.0/kmÂ²). There were 14,811 housing units at an average density of 1,887.1 per square mile (728.5/kmÂ²). The racial makeup of the city was 64.46% [[Race (United States Census)|White]], 1.93% [[Race (United States Census)|Black]] or [[Race (United States Census)|African American]], 0.75% [[Race (United States Census)|American Indian]], 14.88% [[Race (United States Census)|Asian]], 0.27% [[Race (United States Census)|Pacific Islander]], 13.64% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 4.08% from two or more races. 33.47% of the population were [[Hispanics in the United States|Hispanic]] or [[Race (United States Census)|Latino]] of any race. There were 14,580 households out of which 37.4% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 64.1% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 10.4% had a female householder with no husband present, and 21.0% were non-families. 17.3% of all households were made up of individuals and 10.0% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 3.10 and the average family size was 3.49. In the city the population was spread out with 26.2% under the age of 18, 10.7% from 18 to 24, 28.5% from 25 to 44, 20.8% from 45 to 64, and 13.8% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 35 years. For every 100 females there were 93.3 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 88.3 males. The median income for a household in the city was $61,632, and the median income for a family was $66,598 (these figures had risen to $77,952 and $87,037 respectively as of a 2007 estimatehttp://factfinder.census.gov/servlet/ACSSAFFFacts?_event=Search&geo_id=&_geoContext=&_street=&_county=la+mirada&_cityTown=la+mirada&_state=04000US06&_zip=&_lang=en&_sse=on&pctxt=fph&pgsl=010). Males had a median income of $47,364 versus $31,993 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the city was $22,404. About 3.7% of families and 5.6% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 6.1% of those under age 18 and 4.5% of those age 65 or over. ==Government and politics== In the [[California State Legislature|state legislature]] La Mirada is located in the 30th [[California State Senate|Senate]] District, represented by [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrat]] [[Ronald S. Calderon]], and in the 60th [[California State Assembly|Assembly]] District, represented by [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] [[Curt Hagman]]. Federally, La Mirada is located in [[California's 39th congressional district]], which has a [[Cook Partisan Voting Index|Cook PVI]] of D +13{{cite web | title = Will Gerrymandered Districts Stem the Wave of Voter Unrest? | publisher = Campaign Legal Center Blog | url=http://www.clcblog.org/blog_item-85.html | accessdate = 2008-02-10}} and is represented by Democrat [[Linda SÃ¡nchez]]. The city is governed by a five-member [[council-manager government]], each elected [[at-large]] (i.e., by the entire city's voting population, not by districts) to four year terms. Each year the five members vote one of themselves to be the Mayor and Mayor Pro Tem. The [[Los Angeles County Department of Health Services]] operates the Whittier Health Center in [[Whittier, California|Whittier]], serving La Mirada."[http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/phn/docs/HealthCenter/whittier.pdf Whittier Health Center]." [[Los Angeles County Department of Health Services]]. Retrieved on March 18, 2010. ===Emergency services=== The [[Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department]] (LASD) operates the Norwalk Station in [[Norwalk, California|Norwalk]], serving La Mirada."[http://www.lasd.org/stations/for3/norwalk/index.html Norwalk Station]." [[Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department]]. Retrieved on January 21, 2010. In addition the department operates the La Mirada Substation."[http://www.lasd.org/stations/for3/norwalk/lamirada.html La Mirada Substation]." [[Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department]]. Retrieved on January 21, 2010. The Norwalk Station is also responsible for providing contracted police services to the city of Norwalk as well as [[unincorporated area|unincorporated]] [[South Whittier, California|South Whittier]]. The department has a substation in La Mirada located adjacent to City Hall. Many deputies assigned to La Mirada drive [[patrol car]]s marked with the La Mirada logo, but wear Los Angeles County uniforms.{{Citation needed|date=April 2010}} The city also employs a civilian Public Safety team to support the LASD. Public Safety Officers are unarmed and do not have [[arrest]] powers. They carry out ancillary duties such as issuing animal/bicycle licenses, fingerprinting, and writing reports on non-hazardous matters (e.g., forgery, vandalism). They are also charged with enforcing parking and municipal codes.{{Citation needed|date=April 2010}} Fire protection and [[paramedic]] services are provided by the [[Los Angeles County Fire Department]] (LACoFD). The department maintains [[fire station|Station]] #49 in La Mirada adjacent to City Hall, provides coverage to the central parts of the city. Station 49 also serves as the headquarters for Battalion 21. In May 2010 a second fire station, #194 opened at 1401 S. Beach Blvd. at the east city boundary it shares with [[La Habra]]. The placement of the new station filled a gap in coverage for the newer Hillsborough neighborhoods that were built several decades after Station 49 was built. Funding for construction of Station 194 was shared equally by the fire department and the city of [[La Habra]], which benefits at having a fourth engine company in its city limits at no further expense after the station opened. Land constraints necessitated a unique two-story firehouse design which will initially house one engine company and four personnel including one paramedic. Personnel for Engine 194 were obtained without adding any budgeted firefighter positions. 12 of the 27 firefighters positions at the [[Los Angeles County]] fire station near [[La Mirada]] City Hall at the time were shifted to a temporary station 194 when La Habra disbanded it's municipal fire agency in 2005 in favor of becoming a contract city. The construction of the new fire station which was a key component of this agreement was completed in just over four years after a series of design and construction delays. Neighborhoods in eastern La Mirada that once experienced six minute response times can be reached in three minutes or less today. Crews from two nearby stations also include parts of [[La Mirada]] as their first-in district. Engine 35 stationed in [[Cerritos]] on Artesia Blvd covers most of the industrail areas of the city that are south of [[Interstate 5]]. Station 15 located in [[East La Mirada]] on Santa Gertrudes Avenue handles the north and northeast sections of town. The four person crew assigned to [[Quint]] 15 now staff the only truck company in the area. In addition to ladder truck duties a [[Quint]] also has the ability to pump water at a fire. Prior to the 2005 reduction of staff at the La Mirada Blvd station there was a truck staffed as well as the engine and paramedic squad currently staffed. ==Education== [[Public education]] in a majority of La Mirada is governed by the [[Norwalk-La Mirada Unified School District]], headquartered in neighboring [[Norwalk, California|Norwalk]]. La Mirada has one public secondary school, [[La Mirada High School]] The Creek Park and Granada Heights neighborhoods in northern La Mirada are within the boundaries of the [[East Whittier City School District]] K - 8th grade, the [[Whittier Union High School District]], and [[Rio Hondo College]] District all with campuses in nearby Whittier.. Several [[private school]]s are located in La Mirada: * St. Paul of the Cross School in the Foster Park neighborhood * Beatitudes of Our Lord School The city is home to one private [[higher education]] institution, [[Biola University]]. ==Transportation== La Mirada's main arterial streets are Rosecrans Avenue and [[Imperial Highway]]. Valley View Avenue, La Mirada Boulevard, and Santa Gertrudes Avenue are other important arterials. [[Interstate 5 in California|Interstate 5]] passes through the southwest corner of the city, while [[California State Route 39|Beach Boulevard (CA-39)]] passes through the east end of the city. Freight [[railroad]] traffic through the city is handled by [[BNSF Railway]] on its [[right-of-way (transportation)|right-of-way]] in the southwest portion of the city. [[Metrolink (Southern California)|Metrolink]] operates [[commuter rail]] service on this right-of-way; the nearest stations to La Mirada are [[Buena Park (Metrolink station)|Buena Park]] and [[Norwalk/Santa Fe Springs (Metrolink station)|Norwalk/Santa Fe Springs]]. [[Public transportation]] is provided by the [[Los Angeles County Metropolitan Transportation Authority]] (Metro), [[Norwalk Transit (California)|Norwalk Transit]], and [[Montebello Bus Lines]]. ==Economy== ===Top employers=== According to the City's 2009 Comprehensive Annual Financial Report,[http://www.cityoflamirada.org/Modules/ShowDocument.aspx?documentid=855 City of La Mirada CAFR] the top employers in the city are: {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! # ! Employer ! # of Employees |- | 1 |[[Biola University]] |1,248 |- | 2 |[[Norwalk-La Mirada Unified School District]] |900 |- | 3 |[[U.S. Foodservice]] |625 |- | 4 |[[Corporate Express|Staples Advantage]] |367 |- | 5 |Living Spaces |308 |- | 6 |[[Estes Express Lines|Estes]] |292 |- | 7 |[[Frito-Lay]] |266 |- | 8 |[[Hubbell (company)|Architectural Area Lighting]] |146 |- | 9 |[[Spartech]] Plastics |142 |- | 10 |Coyle Reproductions |135 |- |} ==Notable residents== {{ORList}} * [[Gary Allan]], country singer * [[Tony Corrente]], [[National Football League|NFL]] referee * [[Jennie Finch]], Olympic [[softball]] player * [[Janine Lindemulder]], [[exotic dancer]] and adult film actress * [[Amber Riley]], actor and singer best known for her role in ''[[Glee (TV series)|Glee]]'' * [[Derrick Williams (basketball)|Derrick Williams]], basketball player for the [[Minnesota Timberwolves]] * [[Eric Winter]], actor best known for his role in ''[[Days of our Lives]]'' ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Portal|Los Angeles|Greater Los Angeles|Southern California}} *[http://www.cityoflamirada.org/ La Mirada Official Website] {{Geographic Location |Centre = La Mirada |North = [[East La Mirada, California|East La Mirada]]
